Articles.Content:
I have a shuttle project and i have to seperate **only** struts, do you guys have any suggestion? Thanks.

It's a strut connected like below:

![22dq0j.jpg](http://i.hizliresim.com/22dq0j.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-20T18:40:24Z" title="03/20/2015 06:40  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 20, 2015</time> by TYRT**
Put decouplers or docking ports underneath the struts.

I'm confused. If the struts connect two seperate stages they will auto-disconnect upon staging. Also, if you undock a craft that is strutted to the main "mothership," the struts will auto-disconnect again.

Unless it's for purely aesthetic reasons, but even then the struts disappear once they're disconnected. You can't actually see struts that aren't connected to anything.

So...I guess I don't really follow why you would need to disengage the struts independently...

> 
> Put decouplers or docking ports underneath the struts.

Thanks man i tried decouplers, but docking ports are properly working.

I use Extraplanetary Launchpads which allows an Engineer to scrap parts. I have a space station project with an engineer on board whose sorry task is to saw off all the struts on the hab modules I fly up to the station. Works like a charm though ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) If you need to get the strut off during staging you could either use the suggested strut to decoupler.

If the only *other* connection between the two parts is either a docking port, or a separator, then the struts automatically sever when the main connection is broken ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

If there's a reason you want to break the struts without separating the main parts (aesthetics?), you'll need another solution, obviously.
